term.title: photochemical funnel

item.text: Molecular structure where the excited-state reactant or intermediate is delivered to the ground state to initiate product formation.

notes.item: For a broad class of organic reactions, the structure of the funnel can take the form of a conical intersection or a singlet–triplet crossing.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 293. 'Glossary of terms used in photochemistry, 3rd edition (IUPAC Recommendations 2006)' on page 385 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779030293)
